head.title: S.A.T. Doesn't Predict Dropout Rate of Blacks

hedline.hl1: S.A.T. Doesn't Predict Dropout Rate of Blacks

abstract.p: Christine S Cozzens letter contends that May 31 article wrongly uses Harvard Writing Center, which offers peer tutors in writing, as evidence of Harvard's efforts to remediate unprepared students

block.p: Your May 31 Week in Review article wrongly uses the Harvard Writing Center, which offers peer tutors in writing, as evidence of Harvard's efforts to remediate underprepared students.

Like most writing centers at colleges and universities across the country, the Harvard Writing Center offers its services -- one-on-one conversation and guidance aimed at the improvement of writing -- to students of all ability levels.
Your May 31 Week in Review article wrongly uses the Harvard Writing Center, which offers peer tutors in writing, as evidence of Harvard's efforts to remediate underprepared students.

Like most writing centers at colleges and universities across the country, the Harvard Writing Center offers its services -- one-on-one conversation and guidance aimed at the improvement of writing -- to students of all ability levels.

Writing centers often help good writers make their work even better. As an instructor at the Harvard Writing Center in the early 1980's, I developed workshops and tutorials for some of the college's best writers -- honors students working on their senior theses.
The writer directs the Center for Writing and Speaking at Agnes Scott College.
